description.narrative: The main purpose is to support the development of the UN Strategic Framework (UNSF) and other strategic documents as so requested, as well as follow up implementation of the Syrian Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP). The RCO in Syria plays a critical advisory role to the UN Country Team (UNCT) while interfacing with the Government of Syria and NGOs. It contributes to UNCT policy and strategy development processes, and facilitates operational coordination and UN agency presence at UN hubs. Detection of tuberculosis has been a long standing issue in Syria with detection rate below 50% which leads to delay in the start of treatment and further spread of the disease. The Project will address the issue of DOTS for pulmonary TB patients, MDR patients, the engagement of all health providers (Public and Private), support people in vulnerable and poor areas to receive proper treatment and to strengthen the National Tuberculosis Programme Management capacity.

description.narrative: Enhancing Civic Engagement in CSR through inclusive Growth based Civic-private sector partnerships.

This project aims at establishing an innovative Cancer Research Center in Syria in order to diagnose cancer causes with proper technology as well as increasing cancer awareness among men, women and children on early intervention. The Cancer Research Center will help diagnose the cancer causes, diversity frequency and geographical distribution using an innovative laboratory. In addition, the research will serve as a national source of control efforts, including epidemiological study, clinical research, and prevention and cessation intervention development.
